titleInfo.title: [Letter] 1798 July 11, Knoxville, [Tennessee, to] Colo[nel] Henly / John Sevier: a machine-readable transcription of an image

mods.abstract: This document is a letter written to Colonel Henly by John Sevier, Governor of Tennessee from 1796-1801 and 1803-1809, on July 11, 1798. In the letter, John Sevier states that James Calbert, from the Chickasaw Nation has complaints against the United States. Sevier encourages Colonel Henly to listen to the complaints of Calbert and the Chickasaw Nation because of their loyalty and friendship to the United States.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: This MODS record was generated into MODS v3.5 from the TEI teiHeader by University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives, using a stylesheet available at https://github.com/utkdigitalinitiatives/tei-to-mods.
